Summary I was one of the 99th percentile nerds in school. Hence, I've simultaneously held a wide variety of jobs and exercise many skills and talents. My first priority is to continue a career in baseball in one capacity or another. My trauma nursing background allows me to act as a trainer, my degree in statistics helps in compiling coaching stats and scoring games, my physical condition allows me to accept positions as a Strength & Conditioning Coach, my certification as a Medical & Vocational Rehabilitation Specialist aids in my treatment of injuries, I'm experienced in rehabilitating pitcher and player arms while working with one of the most esteemed specialists in the US and I can mow a field, put down lines, fix a mound and run a pro-style workout. I can also bench coach. 
 
In addition, I've been a writer who has sought interesting and challenging assignments for over 25 years. I am experienced in "soft blogging," regular contributions to customers' blogs, writing/rewriting retail catalogues, writing/rewriting online websites, ghostwriting, sports pieces (primarily baseball), health articles, medical articles, drug/medication pieces, fitness instruction, cooking and nutrition articles, technology, travel and e-books. I continue to seek more writing gigs with individuals or companies seeking more than a robotic regurgitation of information and keywords, that pay enough so that I don't qualify for poverty programs and with enough work so that most of my time is not spent seeking work, but DOING it. 
 
My former online portfolio is no longer functional and a great deal of work is lost as many of the sites I wrote for have been updated. A sparkly new website is under construction as I type. Summary Jen Kirsch is a relationship and lifestyle columnist, expert and on-air personality. 
 
She has shared advice as a contributor and has been featured on numerous TV and Radio shows and top-tiered publications, including: Canada AM, CTV News, eTalk, Breakfast Television (Toronto, Calgary, and Winnipeg), The Morning Show on Global TV (National, Toronto and Edmonton), CBC Radio, 680 News, ELLE, Women's Health, Teen VOGUE, Cosmopolitan, National Post, Globe and Mail, Canadian Living, ELLE Canada, Women's Post, Chatelaine, and Toronto Star. 
 
She was the host and relationship expert on Love Trap, a reality-TV show on Cosmo TV and is currently hosting an 8-week series #rupture on Siruis XM 168 on The Todd Shapiro Show, talking to off-and-on couples and gifting a lucky couple with a trip to Vegas. 
 
Her internationally acclaimed blog Blonde, Bronzed, Twentysomething is the go-to site for twentysomethings trying to deal with anything and everything dating/relationship related. Her quick wit and to-the-point tone make her words of wisdom ones that kick in, provoking action and change from readers and followers alike. She recently created her new site, Jentrified, targeted towards 30-40something women.  
 
Jen has a background in Public Relations, working both in-house and agency. Though still passionate about PR, she resigned from her position of Director of PR for a New York based fashion designer, to focus on her writing. She's gotten clients coverage on some of the top TV shows and magazines in the nation, including People Magazine, Entertainment Tonight, Access Hollywood, Harpers Bazaar, Women's Wear Daily, amongst others.  
 
Jen is known as the it-girl by Canadian media to report on relationships. She also leads speaking engagements on dating/relationships, social media and entrepreneurship and has travelled across Canada as a spokesperson for various brands including Virgin Mobile Canada, Dentyne Canada, Durex Canada and Amazing Clubs Canada. Specialties:Relationship articles, relationship advice, lifestyle articles, social media expert, TV & radio personality, relationship coaching, public speaker. She was the host and relationship expert on Love Trap, a reality-TV show on Cosmo TV and is currently hosting an 8-week series #rupture on Siruis XM 168 on The Todd Shapiro Show, talking to off-and-on couples and gifting a lucky couple with a trip to Vegas. 
 
Her internationally acclaimed blog Blonde, Bronzed, Twentysomething is the go-to site for twentysomethings trying to deal with anything and everything dating/relationship related. Her quick wit and to-the-point tone make her words of wisdom ones that kick in, provoking action and change from readers and followers alike. She recently created her new site, Jentrified, targeted towards 30-40something women.  
 
Jen has a background in Public Relations, working both in-house and agency. Though still passionate about PR, she resigned from her position of Director of PR for a New York based fashion designer, to focus on her writing. She's gotten clients coverage on some of the top TV shows and magazines in the nation, including People Magazine, Entertainment Tonight, Access Hollywood, Harpers Bazaar, Women's Wear Daily, amongst others.  
 
Jen is known as the it-girl by Canadian media to report on relationships. She also leads speaking engagements on dating/relationships, social media and entrepreneurship and has travelled across Canada as a spokesperson for various brands including Virgin Mobile Canada, Dentyne Canada, Durex Canada and Amazing Clubs Canada. Summary Chris Morris is an acclaimed freelance writer, editor and broadcaster specializing in the video game and consumer electronics industries. He is also an editorial leader and strategic planner, with experience at some of the Internet’s biggest names (CNN, Yahoo!, Forbes.com). Equally adept at writing compelling copy and forming and improving interdepartmental and partner relations, he regularly delivers significant increases in page views and unique users. Experience in all fields of media, having achieved success in print, radio and online – and a frequent guest on television news programs. 
 
He has appeared on The CBS Evening News, CNN, CNBC, CNN Headline News, CNN International, CNNfn, G4 and Spike TV. He is a frequent radio commentator, having been asked to discuss gaming and financial matters on hundreds of stations around the country. Referred to by Gamespot.com as “one of the most game-savvy reporters in the mainstream media,” Chris has also served as a judge for the E3 Critics Awards and sat on the Board of Advisors for Spike TV’s Video Game Awards Show. 
 
Also a skilled moderator and public speaker, Chris has headed panels at SXSW, CES, Digital Hollywood and the Game Developers Conference.

- Expertise in the field of video game journalism, having covered the industry for nearly 20 years.  
 
- Effective communicator, having coordinated countless multi-department product launches and maintained relationships with over 40 external editorial partners. 
 
- Expertise in strategic development of editorial packages (from inception through execution)

Summary JC (Jessica) Torpey took 10+ years of IT experience and turned it into a writing career. Specializing in tech, JC has a background in customer service and management, though she slings dating and relationship advice with the best of them.  
 
JC is a Goth at heart living Geek Chic living in Philadelphia, PA, with her husband and two cats; JC combines her knowledge of tech with her passion for writing hoping to captivate, educate, and guide those willing to learn.  
 
She trained hands on with an IT company, while self teaching, and she eventually earned some IT and writing certifications along the way. Some include:  
 
Email Etiquette & Telephone Etiquette 
U.S. English Skills, Word Usage, Written English, English Vocabulary & English Spelling 
U.S. English Sentence Structure and Punctuation and Mechanics (For Writing Professionals)  
Online Article Writing & Blogging & Spanish to English Translation Skills  
Advertising Skills & Business Writing Skills  
Fundamentals of Windows XP & Windows 7, Adobe Photoshop & Adobe Illustrator 
 
JC’s experience includes everything from identifying and removing malware, general PC and Internet security and maintenance, data back up and restoration, all things Microsoft. She also writes about a range of non-tech topics such as dating and relationships, politics to SEO, SEM, SMM, green living, pets, and the insurance industry, and much more.  
 
A Featured Technology Contributor until the program ended in December 2012, JC earned the Best of AC Award in June 2010 for her technology articles and the Top 1000 Contributor Award in 2010, 2011, and 2012.  
 
When JC isn't writing, you can find her studying to earn more certificates in art, design, writing and IT. JC will return to college in the fall of 2013, and she hopes to graduate with a degree in Journalism and Mass communications with a minor in Political Science and Government, and a specialization Web Design and Development in 2015.
